the famous places bring tourists mostly and high prices.  quite expensive for a stall, but was tasty.  chef has a sister restaurant in Beijing called Migas.  closed sun/mon.  they start preparing food at 7 am, but you don't need to arrive until after the market is open.  would order the egg dishes made from scratch such as with chipirones or the seasonal llanqueta (tiny fried fish). nice runny eggs.  can see how they cook in different pans (steel vs. cast iron) with a lot of oil and the sea salt to get the wet sauce just right.  the grilled octopus with leeks was delicious but also salty.  same with the oxtail with potato (more starchy), bold savory flavor, salty, perfect with the excellent baguette bread.  if comparing this place and Pinotxo, then would go to Pinotxo first, especially with better prices and also great flavors there.
